fields.description: Engineers should have the ability to quarantine failing automated tests without requiring full admin privileges to the plan; Devops keeps a fairly stringent hold on the details of the plans to ensure they meet minimum criteria for execution, but engineers responsible for test failures should be able to have the leeway to isolate failing tests without requiring intervention from plan administrators.
fields.summary: Extract "Quarantine Test" permission from "Admin Plan"

fields.description:
<xxx>:~ sysadmin$ locale
LANG="ru_RU.UTF-8"
LC_COLLATE="ru_RU.UTF-8"
LC_CTYPE="ru_RU.UTF-8"
LC_MESSAGES="ru_RU.UTF-8"
LC_MONETARY="ru_RU.UTF-8"
LC_NUMERIC="ru_RU.UTF-8"
LC_TIME="ru_RU.UTF-8"
LC_ALL=
<skip>:~ sysadmin$ hg -v
Распределенная система контроля версий Mercurial

Основные команды:

 add           добавить указанный файл при следующей фиксации
 annotate, blame

Bamboo reacts to this with 
An unexpected error has occurred
Error encountered while triggering manual build: com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException: Mercurial Executable capability `/opt/local/bin/hg' does not seem to be a hg client. Is it properly set?
Plan 'Y-X1' did not start

Entering  'export LANG="en_US.UTF-8"' in shell before starting Bamboo fixes this.
Problem itself is that if LANG is not en - Mercurial shows it's banner in native language and Bamboo thinks it's not Mercurial
fields.summary: Mercurial detection is wrong if LANG is non-US

fields.description:
It's showing branch name where the plan name would normally be:

!notification plan name.png!
fields.summary: Bamboo not displaying plan name in build notification for a plan branch
Provide an easy UI feature to point to the keystore file and change Bamboo to work via HTTPS

fields.description:
When estimating time remaining for a plan or stage, the numbers are skewed by parent builds and/or the amount of time spent waiting for an agent, it seems.

It would be useful, for metrics, to have both absolute time spent, but also time spent specifically on a plan, to be able to understand changes inside a plan that affect build execution time, vs. larger environment issues.
fields.summary: "Estimated time remaining" for plan execution includes time spent waiting for agents/parent plans

fields.description:
We get a daily backup error that ends up with this:
{code}

2012-08-08 02:02:50,614 ERROR [QuartzScheduler_Worker-2] [ScheduledBackupJob] com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.OsgiServiceProxyFactory
Impl$ServiceTimeoutExceeded: Timeout exceeded waiting for service - com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.Backup
com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.OsgiServiceProxyFactoryImpl$ServiceTimeoutExceeded: Timeout exceeded waiting for service - com.atlass
ian.activeobjects.spi.Backup
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.OsgiServiceProxyFactoryImpl$DynamicServiceInvocationHandler.invoke(OsgiServiceProxyFactory
Impl.java:152)
        at $Proxy687.save(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.stream.activeobjects.ActiveObjectsMapper.exportData(ActiveObjectsMapper.java:41)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator.exportToStream(XmlMigrator.java:569)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator.exportXml(XmlMigrator.java:490)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator$$FastClassByCGLIB$$b6578fc7.invoke(<generated>)
        at net.sf.cglib.proxy.MethodProxy.invoke(MethodProxy.java:149)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.Cglib2AopProxy$CglibMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(Cglib2AopProxy.java:694)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
        at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.Cglib2AopProxy$DynamicAdvisedInterceptor.intercept(Cglib2AopProxy.java:629)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator$$EnhancerByCGLIB$$217e0c32.exportXml(<generated>)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.ImportExportManagerImpl.bambooExport(ImportExportManagerImpl.java:68)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.configuration.ScheduledBackupJob.execute(ScheduledBackupJob.java:72)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:202)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.quartz.SystemAuthorizedThreadPool$1.run(SystemAuthorizedThreadPool.java:38)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:525)
{code}

There is also that infameous yellow warning banner ("Bamboo failed to run the backup on 08 Aug 2012. See the logs for further details.") with an invisible close link. This installation was an upgrade from a previous version and I suspect this might have gone wrong somehow?

Is there anything we can do to get rid of this problem?
fields.summary: Backup completes, but with an error (On Tomcat 7)

fields.description: The message stays there even after logout/login.
fields.summary: Warning message of failed scheduled backup sticks to the Bamboo screen and doesn't go away

fields.description: Should take you to executing job.
fields.summary: Job link off EC2 instances page goes to job summary

fields.description:
*Considering the real/correct Visual Studio installation paths:*
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 9.0\VC\vcvarsall.bat
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 9.0\Common7\IDE\devenv.com

*And the influence of the the BAM_VS_DIR local variable, causing the paths to be formated like this:*
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 9.0\Common7\VC\vcvarsall.bat *(unnecessary "Common7")*
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 9.0\Common7\Common7\IDE\devenv.com *(duplicated "Common7")*

We need to remove the "Common7" part of our predefined "BAM_VS_DIR" variable as it causes the path to be malformed.

*Workaround:* use a script task to re-export the variable before the build starts.
1. Run "echo %BAM_VS_DIR%" to find the current variable value.
2. Create a Script Task to be run at the very beginning of the build in order to fix the variable value. Add to the task the following code to be run: 
{code}
export BAM_VS_DIR="new_path_without_Common7"
{code}
fields.summary: Wrong BAM_VS_DIR variable definition makes EC2 dotNet builds fail

fields.description: For reference, it could be useful if there was an option to display line numbers next to the logs to make it simple to refer to chunks of the log output without having to download to a text editor.
fields.summary: Display line numbers with logs

fields.description:
When adding a task to a plan with a lot of jobs it takes longer and longer time to add them depending on the size of the plan. 

100 jobs with 3 tasks each takes 34 seconds to create 200 jobs with 3 tasks each take 208 seconds in a test we did. The scaling of this is very bad. 
400 jobs would take 80 minutes and a 1000 jobs would take forever.
fields.summary: Adding tasks in plan with many jobs via taskConfigurationService is slow

fields.description: it ssh's me in as ec2-user which can't even get into /home/bamboo ...
fields.summary: EC2 ssh command does not allow me to do much

fields.description: When configuring HipChat notifications there is only a plain text box for specifying the chat room. The configuration should be improved by providing a dynamic list of rooms that can be chosen from.
fields.summary: Dynamic room selector for HipChat integration
IM server not configured warning not applicable if you use HipChat

fields.description:
In complex multi-agent multi-dependency build situations, it would be really nice to have a single "airplane mode" like switch that would disable all SCM checks and ensure that only a select group of users would be able to execute builds; 

The goal here would be to ensure, for debugging, that we're not suddenly queued behind a commit to a random project.
fields.summary: Admin override to pause all SCM checks, lockdown ability to manually execute builds

fields.description:
When Bamboo is integrated with Crowd, Bamboo should allow going to the profile and changing the IM address and source repository alias of a user because the IM address and source repository alias is saved in Bamboo even though Bamboo uses Crowd as a user repository.

When Read-only External User Management flag is un-checked, and Crowd (I tried version 2.4.0) doesn't allow making changes for a specific user account, Bamboo shows this error if attempted to change the IM address (or other user settings).

{code}
An unexpected error has occurred
Trying to modify underlying user store but the operation is not allowed. Bamboo is most likely to be incorrectly setup. Please ensure that Read-only External User Management flag is checked.
{code}

Also, maybe the communication of Bamboo and Crowd can be improved to let Bamboo know about the Directory permissions in Crowd so that Bamboo knows that there can be no changes done (as it is read only). This way, let's say the Read-only External User Management flag automatically can be disabled if Crowd doesn't allow to make changes in user settings. However, this is not related to the IM address as it is saved in Bamboo only, and Bamboo should allow making IM address changes. 

h2. Workaround
Check *Read-only external user management* at *Bamboo Administration >> Overview >> Security settings*
fields.summary: Bamboo should allow changing the IM address and source repository aliases of a user from Crowd

fields.description: Currently, when an agent fails the build turns yellow. It would be very useful to have the build scheduled for a retry. This is especially useful when using EC2 Spot instances which can be quite dynamic.
fields.summary: Restart build when agent fails (HW failure etc.)

# Verify that the plan is accessible through the browser

fields.summary: Referral to a non-existing plan should throw a warning rather than crashing with NPE
Bamboo remote agent wrapper shell script force resets $PATH using su -m

fields.description:
On windows (ami-91518ef8) the java6 is wrong.
On linux (ami-54399e3d) the mvn 3 was wrong.
fields.summary: Maven 3 and Java 6 path is wrong for Windows Elastic Image

fields.description: Whenever there is no any capable agent to build a job, it will be queued indefinitely . This can be quite misleading. It will be nice if Bamboo gives a warning rather than just queuing the job.
fields.summary: Bamboo should provide a very meaningful message when no agent is available to build

fields.description:
Specifically, the master, under System Information, provides information about its local environment, et al.

The remotes only report back very specific details about the bamboo process itself, and a little about the hardware. Having the same information about the remote agents as available on the master would assist with environmental issues, as well as bring the two agent-types more into sync with what details they report.
fields.summary: Remote agents should provide identical information to the master as what's in System Information

fields.description: The ability to create a JIRA issue linked _directly_ from a failed test case, which could therefore include the context of the failed test directly, would be a smooth addition to the Bamboo->JIRA integration workflow.
fields.summary: "Create Issue" button next to "Quarantine"

fields.description:
Reporting for test failures on the Test Results screen seem to display in a different order than the execution of the tests, although I'm not certain what order they actually display in.

For instance, we have a series of tests 1..100; the logs show the tests executing in a specific order, but the Test Results page seems to jump around the failure results; I see failures 1-6, but then 20-24, then back to 7, etc.

These are straight up mvn test results in the default location.
fields.summary: Test failures reporting out-of-execution order
Provide mechanism for aspect-oriented cross-cutting plans/stages/jobs

fields.description:
The customer uses 'magic trick': he defines shared repo with variable to define actual repository path.

I suspect the variable is not overriden properly during dependency triggering and Bamboo 'thinks' that both plans use the same repository

See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-7781
fields.summary: Git source control checkout uses wrong sha1 when triggered as dependant build

fields.description:
Related to BAM-11990, notifications of tests that are quarantined but now pass would be useful for following up on open issues, etc.

If BAM-11990 is eventually picked up, notifications on auto-unleash would be equally useful.
fields.summary: Notification options for passing but quarantined tests

fields.description: The option to "Quarantine until pass" would be a boon to allowing a workflow in which failed tests are created as an issue and quarantined. At this point, its a manual process to review quarantined tests on a regular basis and unleash them manually.
fields.summary: Option to auto-unleash passing quarantined tests

fields.description: In complex Bamboo environments, its not always easy to track down the potential execution path of builds based on parent/child and block/don't block relationships; something like the JIRA workflow visualization, in which there's a simple, fast page to look at from any build to see where its coming from and where its going would be useful.
fields.summary: Visualization of full dependent-build tree

fields.description:
Test results are specified as ant-style globs, but inclusion/exclusion from the source repository is a straight-up PCRE-style regex. 

It would be nice to think: "oh; bamboo, that's <pickyourcodestyleandmoveon>
fields.summary: Standardize regex matches across Bamboo

fields.description:
Not a common use case, but I've encountered two situations now where for one reason or another, I'd like to be able to promote a detected branch to its own top-level plan; this mostly revolves around testing-related plans, but I could see its potential usefulness for splitting off codelines that start to have divergent build plans. 

Also, cf. BAM-8414, BAM-11035, BAM-11580, BAM-995 and BAM-3009
fields.summary: Provide mechanism to promote plan-branch to plan and/or plan to branch

fields.description:
Probably mostly encapsulated by BAM-9613 et al., but it would be great, similar to the idea of notification schemes in BAM-11982, to have a set of centralized permission schemes that are generally applicable to projects en masse, rather than handling individual permissions on each project. 

BAM-8414 also discusses some of this in a deeper, richer way, so I'm referencing it here just for posterity.
fields.summary: Improved granularity on Bamboo permissions (a la JIRA Permission Schemes)

fields.description: Tasks, Jobs and Stages should all have mechanisms to conditionally apply a label to a build based on certain criteria; Success or Failure would be a good place to start, but based on some of the other open requests for more complex workflows and workflow engines in Bamboo (cf. BAM-972, BAM-10261), potentially arbitrary criteria could apply down the road.
fields.summary: Conditional build labels

fields.description:
I know this is on the radar, but for some reason I couldn't find an open issue referencing this in JAC;

On the one hand, it would be nice to be able to simply specify an artifact as a dependency, regardless of which plan it came out of (longer integration-test type plans come to mind) without having to resort to an external shared storage system, but another possible solution would be a build plugin that could natively handle the RESTful call API/parse JSON/extract artifacts cycle needed to use published artifacts from other plans, and such a plugin might be more flexible than simply extending the "shared artifact" model.
fields.summary: Cross-plan build artifacts or built-in plugins for handling RESTful cross-plan links

fields.description:
The /latest shortcut on a build plan is a nice mechanism to get details on the latest build, both from a UI as well as an API perspective. That said, something I'd say is critically lacking is the ability to GET /latestSuccessful or /latestFailed without having to load all the results and parse the resulting JSON output.

Regardless of 'latestFailed', about which I'll reference a few yet-to-be-filed issues shortly, it seems like the ability to rapidly select /latestSuccessful is a significantly missing chunk of functionality.
fields.summary: Provide add'l semantic shortcuts for latest builds by status

fields.description: Similar to JIRA notification schema, it would be nice to be able to set up several notification systems by group/role and simply apply those to multiple projects, rather than having to manually manage notifications individually on a project by project basis.
fields.summary: Notification Schemes for Bamboo

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Moving Jira issues to another project breaks the connection between Bamboo build and Jira issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two projects in Jira
 # Create an issue in one of the projects and link it to a build on bamboo.
 (i) At this point, the details of the Jira issue should be shown in Bamboo:
 !image-2019-09-03-14-36-12-935.png|width=1105,height=75!
 # Move the issue to the other project.
 # Reload the issue page on bamboo.
 (i) At this point, the details of the Jira issue is now missing on Bamboo after the issue has been moved to another project.
 !image-2019-09-03-14-38-26-409.png|width=1101,height=77!

h3. Expected Results

Bamboo should show the details from Jira issue if the issue was moved.
h3. Actual Results

Bamboo can't obtain issue details from Jira.
h3. Workaround
 # Remove the link between Jira and Bamboo manually in *Plan's configuration > Issues tab* and click on the button *Remove linked Jira Issue*.
 # Add the link between Jira and Bamboo manually in *Plan's configuration > Issues tab* and click on the button *Add linked issues*.
fields.summary: Linked JIRA issues that are moved to a different project don't show details

fields.description:
We have 2 different versions of integration docs for Bamboo:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Integrating+Crowd+with+Atlassian+Bamboo
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Integrating+Bamboo+with+Crowd

which is rather confusing. 
[This page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Integrating+Bamboo+with+Crowd] refers to the other docs to configure Crowd and the step 2 is duplicated in both documentation.
fields.summary: Redo Crowd Integration docs

fields.description:
Used the following MS Test results file naming convention:
<Project-Test-Subfolder>\TestResults\<Project>TestResults-Build_${bamboo.buildNumber}-Rev_${bamboo.repository.revision.number}.trx

Which worked okay until we hit build #10, which should have passed. Found that the results parser was pull failures from older build 7 and bringing and failing the run.

My work-around is to reverse the rev and build variables in the file to:
<Project-Test-Subfolder>\TestResults\<Project>TestResults-Rev_${bamboo.repository.revision.number}-Build_${bamboo.buildNumber}.trx

a) Would make sense for the parser to key off of test results file's creation dates instead.
b) Would be nice if the timestamp variable was filename friendly (that's what I would have used instead to make Test Result file name unique.)
fields.summary: MSTest Parser gets old Test Results if numerical sequence crosses 9 to 10

fields.description:
Documentation should include examples for naming TestResults file and indicate that they need to be unique names.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/MSTest+Parser
fields.summary: Update the documentation to mention name uniqueness of TestResults

fields.description:
As a developer, I want my team to be able to use Bamboo to build _and_ test Scala projects using [SBT|http://www.scala-sbt.org/].

SBT is the de facto build tool used for dependency resolution, building, and testing of [Scala|http://www.scala-lang.org/] projects including those based on popular development frameworks such as [Lift|http://liftweb.net/] and [Play! 2.0|http://playframework.org/].
fields.summary: Support building and testing Scala Simple Build Tool (SBT) projects

fields.description:
I find it very confusing to have "Advanced Options" part under every repository configuration page. Based on my experience this kind of tickets got raised:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-11973
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-10581

I had to contact to a developer to know about "Verbose logs" for Git, or about "Automatically detect root URL for" for SVN.

This means that every time a new feature gets implemented and added into the advanced options section, users will have a hard time to find them(know about the existence of those features).

Please don't fold the repository configuration page and let it be shown as a list of options instead of having hidden sections.
fields.summary: Show the whole configuration of the plan repository configuration without folding "Advanced Options" part

fields.description:
Currently if a user doesn't want to run a subset of tasks in a job, he has to remove them, and in case he needs them later, he has to recreate all those deleted tasks again.

Let's say we can create a dedicated area in Tasks section to drag and drop tasks that will not be executed. Another implementation would be adding a check-box on each plan which will allow to enable/disable each task easily.
fields.summary: Add a feature to allow enable/disable tasks easier

fields.description: Can we improve the Export/backup process for Bamboo to apply at least the same conditions as it does during the Import? The problem is that sometimes Bamboo does the export "successfully", but the reality is that some corruptions are not checked during the export, and the created backup cannot be imported later.
fields.summary: Bamboo generates backups that cannot be imported later
Please add parsing changelogs of SVN externals in Bamboo

fields.description:
When Bamboo cannot find the "bamboo-admin" group in JIRA or Crowd, it reports: "Failed to change the active user repository: At least one administrator 
required, but none were found. The following administrator groups were 
searched: [bamboo-admin]"

Please add in the error that the group should exist in JIRA or in Crowd depending on the situation.
fields.summary: Improve the error message of the Bamboo JIRA integration

fields.description:
The following is the result from building the project in command line: !maven.png! And the following is the bamboo build log: {noformat} command 30-Jul-2012 15:59:59 Beginning to execute external process for build 'Maven1beta - Maven1beta - Default Job'

fields.summary: Problems with trailing backslash and Maven 1.x

fields.description: When Bamboo (OnDemand) is restarted (due to weekly upgrades) elastic instances that are running and not to be shutdown (automatic elastic instance management disabled) lose connection. Once Bamboo is back up, that connection should be recovered.
fields.summary: Recover connection with running elastic instances after a Bamboo (OnDemand) restart

fields.description:
How to stop the server
- check there are instructions for restarting
Include note about elastic instances
fields.summary: Document how to stop Bamboo

fields.description:
If I go to the plan branches page (which lists all branches, like on allPlans dashboard) you can hover your mouse over branch name and a 'title' attribute will appear. The 'title' is currently populated with issue-linked-to-branch description. This come very handy if you don't remember what branch you are after - hovering your mouse over a branch name gives some context.

I'd like to have the same behavior when dropping down the breadcrumbs branch selector - that is, when I hover over some branch name I'd like to see (as a 'title' popup) the branch description.

See attached screenshots.
fields.summary: Display linked issue description in breadcrumbs branch selector

fields.description: Like Stash, Fisheye and Bitbucket, Bamboo should provide a way to link Git revisions to the Github web interface
fields.summary: GitHub web repository type

fields.description:
Hello,

I have 2 stages, the 1st stage contains several test runs and the 2nd stage only contains 1 job with a Final Task.

When some of these test jobs fail, the final task of the single job in the 2nd stage is never executed.

As per Marek's comment's (https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/43099/using-clover-together-with-bamboo-stages) this should work (even though I was surprised to hear that).

What I am trying to achieve here is to run some tests and have Clover code analysis reporting in the final stage, having no coverage report when one of the tests fail is not really handy.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Final Task of Stage is not executed when previous Stage failed
Handle killing child processes of Bamboo builds running on Windows

fields.description:
The helpful popup window that comes up when configuring a task to show the list of available plan variables has an incomplete list of variables.  The lists of available variables in the Bamboo documentation are also incomplete ( for instance, found custom.svn.lastchange.revision.number via a trawl through the jira issues, which solves a problem that had been a minor annoyance to me for a while ).

Please set your legions of technical writers to work finding all the locations in the Bamboo documentation and codebase where these variables are generated and listed, and have one definitive überlist.
fields.summary: Please update Bamboo documentation to include a more complete list of available plan variables

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1) use REST api to add a 'test' label to a plan (that has no such label)
1a) in the UI the plan won't be displaying 'test' label
1b) while I'd expect it will 
1c) note the label was added to the db table buildresultsummary_label
2) edit configuration of that plan and save it (for example changed the plan name from "Plan name" to "Plan name2")
3) observe the label appeared in the UI
fields.summary: Changing labels via REST api doesn't refresh configuration in the web UI

fields.description:
We have bamboo integrated with JIRA. 
The bamboo config currently uses 4 plans (dependant on each other) - Create Build , Deploy build - load test data - Run unit tests

In JIRA I see all 4 plans but really only want to see the Create Build plans deatils there. Is there a way to filter out the builds being shown in the JIRA Builds tab.

As we are branching there may be 8/12/16 planns associated with an issue. So just showbng the "create build" plans could keep things cleaner
fields.summary: Only show certain build plans in JIRA
Expose the Commit Message in a Build Variable

fields.description: We should have similar improvements for the Github connector as we did for the Bitbucket connector
fields.summary: UX for Github connector

fields.description:
* File a bug with AMKT (ecosystem.atlassian.net) for the broken link
* Directly to category https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/app/bamboo/popular?category=Bamboo+Tasks
fields.summary: Get more tasks link on task browser is broken

fields.description: This is pretty minor, but if you delete all jobs from a stage, then try to delete that stage, the warning message says the stage has "0 job".
fields.summary: Pluralization error in the delete stage message for empty stages

fields.description: \The spinner will continue to spin, and the error message sits weird.
fields.summary: Create Branch error handling looks broken

fields.description: If the branch is manually created, it should have the 'Do not expire' checkbox enabled
fields.summary: Dont expire branch checkbox on by default for manually created branches.

fields.description:
* Implement mockup (see attached)
** For Subversion, the branches root section should still be at the top of the screen!
* heading "Automatic Branch Detection" change to "Automatically Manage branches"
** Description "Bamboo will automatically manage the creation of new branches when Bamboo detects a new branch in your version control system and the removal of the branch from Bambooo after a specified period of inactivity. Detection of new branches runs every 5 minutes."
** "Enabled checkbox" becomes "Automatically manage branches"

* Remove after "Enabled" checkbox is removed and remove after becomes part of the same section as "Automatically manage branches"

* Remove after description "Branches will be automatically removed after a specified period if no commits to the VCS branch have been made. You can exclude individual Branches on their Branch Details pages. Branches will not be removed from your Version Control System and cleanup runs daily at 3am."

* Create an upgrade task to disable automatic removal if the automatically manage branches checkbox is disabled.
** Since enabling automatic creation and automatic removal will be combined, it wont be possible to enable, disable or change the automatic removal value

* Move "Notifications" section to the very bottom of the page

* If the expiry is zero, do not expire branches
fields.summary: Combine "Automatic Detection" and "Automatic removal" into a single "Automatically manage branches" feature

You have no idea what branches even exist yet, cause you haven't loaded the repos.  This field should not show up until after the repositories are loaded.

Also when you click "load repositories" the "default" stays there but the "Branch" disapears so you just have a floating word...

fields.summary: On the Gitbucket branch, NPE on Permission manager

fields.description: Causes 'build definition snapshot' problem - the build definition is no longer taken from the master chain.
fields.summary: Mismatch between 'merged' status of XML and BuildDefinition
Exception on My Bamboo -> My Broken Plans
Branch selector should display names of subversion branches
Update the plan branches doco for the single "Automatically manage branches" feature

fields.description:
Using this source:
https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/browse/bamboo-hg/components/bamboo-language/src/main/resources/help-paths.properties?r=HEAD
fields.summary: Check that all help links have a target in the Bamboo help-paths.properties file

fields.description:
When creating a new job you click the create job button and you get a dialog to either create or clone.  You then pick one option, which opens another dialog.  However when you submit the second dialog, it closes and forces a page refresh.  But while your waiting for the page to refresh the initial dialog (create or clone) is visible.

Its a bit disjointed to have that original dialog open still.
fields.summary: Create Job original dialog still open after save.

fields.description:
Currently Elastic Bamboo requires you give it your account level credentials to run properly. This isn't really acceptable in many environments and we should be able to use IAM to create a bamboo user with restricted permission (i.e. bamboo doesn't need permissions to create a new VPC, or delete non-bamboo instances).

To me this is a major security problem. The response so far from support was this: 

"After confirming with the Bamboo seniors, I can say that the Bamboo user does need full access to the account. We also recommend that a dedicated account be created for Bamboo to ensure that, should Bamboo "go sideways," any damage is restricted only to the Bamboo user's account."

Running a dedicated account just for bamboo isn't horribly practical if you have other resources the builds depend on, especially in a VPC environment.
fields.summary: Bamboo requires full permissions to EC2

fields.description:
Currently when an elastic instance is created using spot instances, the availability zone preference isn't being used for the spot request. This means EC2 randomly picks the AZ to put the instance in causing unwanted data transfer costs.

If you look at the screen shots you'll see my preference was us-east-1d however the spot request that was generated had an empty AZ field.
fields.summary: Spot instances aren't being created in the correct availability zone

fields.description: As Hg does already - for better subrepositories handling
fields.summary: git repository should allow to switch caching repository off

fields.description: We upgrade the embedded version of clover occasionally, but this potentially forces customers to get a new license.  It would be cool if they could pick what version of clover to use somehow.
fields.summary: Improved compatability between embedded clover version and users license

fields.description: When using the Bitbucket and Github connectors, the users repositories should be shown first in the list
fields.summary: Show my bitbucket and github repositories first in the list

fields.description: Providing the ability to hide the 'Disconnected Instances' view will prevent customers unknowingly shut down their AWS instances by accident
fields.summary: Ability to disable 'Disconnected Instances' view in Bamboo admin

fields.description:
If I run the bamboo application as "Administrator" the test runner (MSTest) runs as "Administrator" (and Runs).
If I run the bamboo application as "SYSTEM" the test runner (MSTest) runs as a different user instead of SYSTEM (and Fails).

{code}
build	17-Jul-2012 19:02:29	Loading JCPS/JCPS.Tests/bin/JCPS.Tests.dll...
build	17-Jul-2012 19:02:29	JCPS/JCPS.Tests/bin/JCPS.Tests.dll
build	17-Jul-2012 19:02:29	The directory name is invalid.
{code}
fields.summary: MSTest Runner task fails if Bamboo is getting run as a SYSTEM user

fields.description:
Symptoms:
builds with merge strategies fail upon push, although the push itself is successful (i.e. data is pushed).
reruns of these builds are successful
fields.summary: Git push does not work through SSH proxy

fields.description: If a shared artifact is missing we immediately stop everything and fail the build.  But we should not stop collecting other artifacts, because those artifacts might be useful in figuring out why it failed.
fields.summary: If a shared artifact is missing we should not stop collecting other artifacts

fields.description:
I merged the master branch into my feature branch and now the plan branch is showing 41766 commits:

!bamboo changes.png!

This is on 4.2-m2 build 3202
fields.summary: Bamboo showing >41k commits for a build

fields.description: Our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Legacy+remote+agent+installation+guide] on legacy remote agent should be edited to reflect the fact that the properties file need to be placed in the jar file directory
fields.summary: The documentation should be edited to mention that for remote agents installed in legacy mode, the bamboo-capabilities.properties should be placed next to the jar file

fields.description:
Currently jobs can access their job key using {{$\{bamboo.buildKey\}}}, which gives a key in the form of PROJECT-PLAN-JOB. 

I would also like access to the top level plan's key of the form PROJECT-PLAN, as well as the corresponding top level plan name.
fields.summary: Expose top level plan keys and plan names as variables

fields.description:
This morning JBAC couldn't start ec2 instances, and threw an error:

{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.util.TreeMap.getEntry(TreeMap.java:324)
	at java.util.TreeMap.get(TreeMap.java:255)
	at com.atlassian.aws.ec2.SpotPriceMatrix.getPrice(SpotPriceMatrix.java:110)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.server.SpotInstanceConfig.getBid(SpotInstanceConfig.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.server.RemoteElasticInstanceImpl$Starter.run(RemoteElasticInstanceImpl.java:225)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:441)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:98)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:206)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
{noformat}

It fixed itself after 30 minutes or so, so perhaps this is a passing failure from ec2.
fields.summary: Error starting ec2 instances

fields.description: Nowadays PostgreSQL 9.1 is not a supported version. Some customers are starting to use this version (released 2011 september) so maybe we should ensure that will be supported.
fields.summary: Support for PostgreSQL 9.1

fields.description: In the same way that we provide [bin/customise-extras.sh|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Configuring+Elastic+Instances+to+use+the+EBS#ConfiguringelasticinstancestousetheEBS-EBSdirectoriesfilesImportantEBSDirectoriesandFiles] for the startup customizations, would be also good to provide a script that can be run when the image is shutdown.
fields.summary: Provide Shutdown Hook for EC2 Image

fields.description: Builds stopped at a manual stage before export are not continuable after import.
fields.summary: isContinuable field not included in import/export

fields.description:
Please see attached screenshot.

Text reads:

"Can't detect branches for plan <Plan>. It's default repository does not support automatic branch detection"

It should read:

""Can't detect branches for plan <Plan>. Its default repository does not support automatic branch detection"
fields.summary: Typo in an unsupported plan branch repository error message
Provide the option to add trunk in the subject line for trunk submissions.

fields.description:
As part of Bamboo 4's UI changes, it appears some functionality was removed.
Specifically:
# The existence of the plan navigator on the plan summary page. This now only appears when configuring the plan, or from the job summary view/config pages. This is adding to the time it takes to get to the details of job from the plan summary screen
# The "Configuration" tab on the plan summary screen. This provided a convenient read-only listing of the current plans configuration. Now it appears we have to edit the configuration just to see what the current settings are.

Is is possible to:
# Re-instate the plan navigator on the plan summary screen as an hide-able sidebar, behaving the same as it does on the job summary screens?
# Restore some way to view a read-only version of the plan configuration from the plan summary screen?

For large instances like ours, such time savers mean a great deal to us.
fields.summary: Bamboo plan summary page no longer includes stages/jobs sidebar and configuration tab

fields.description: In JIRA and confluence, we have implemented these feature as per this ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-15017. It will be nice to include this feature for Bamboo as well to help in troubleshooting issues faster
fields.summary: Add summary of modified or removed files to System Info

fields.description:
The permissions help text mentions restricted admins, even though in most cases you can't set the restricted admin. (Its a seperate option you have to turn on).

We should make the help text dynamic and only show restricted admin text if restricted admin is turned on.
fields.summary: Configure Permissions Page mentions restricted admin when not restricted admin option present
